#Series 1 Combat Mechs
The cheapest and most frequently deployed Mechs, most often utilized as a suit of Powered Armor for infantry conflicts and boarding actions.
All S1 Mechs are space insulated, provide breathable atmosphere, and have maneuvering jets.
##Gygax
The Gygax is a fast, lightly-armored strike platform. It is vulnerable to handheld weaponry, but provides its operator protection from common combat injuries.
##Durand
The Durand is a slow, lumbering, heavily armored tank. It is vulnerable to concentrated fire but is durable enough to walk off injuries that would disable or destroy a Gygax.
##Weaponry
- The Ultra AC-2 is a highly accurate light machine gun. - The LBX AC-10 is a light automatic shotgun that fires standard 12-guage buckshot. - The FNX-99 Hades Carbine is a light automatic shotgun that fires 12-gauge incendiary shells. - The SRM-8 Light Missile Rack is a self-loading unguided rocket launcher useful for breaching airlock doors.
- The CH-PD Disabler is a mech-mounted varient of the standard handheld Disabler. - The SGL-6 Flashbang Launcher does exactly what you would expect, for a surprisingly low cost.
- The CH-PS Firedart is the mech-mounted equivalent to a Makeshift Laser Pistol. - The CH-LC Solaris is equivalent to a standard Laser Rifle. - The ZFI Immolation Beam Gun is equivalent to a Laser Cannon.
##Syndicate Mechs
The [color=crimson]Syndicate[/color] created variations of the standard powered armor Mechs which were provided to Nuclear Operatives in their station-destroying operations. These can still rarely be found deployed in the Colossus Sector.
These mechs are invariably better than the standard-issue versions, featuring significant improvements to armor plating and an expanded equipment capacity.
